pattern.description: Deploy Pulsar as the inter-process messaging fabric.  Pulsar is a Cloud-native, distributed messaging and Streaming. Apache Pulsar is an open-source, distributed messaging and streaming platform built for the cloud.  Trustgraph uses Pulsar to manage the message flow between all components.
pattern.name: pulsar
pattern.title: Deploy foundation messaging fabric

pattern.description: Adds Pulsar Manager which provides a web interface to manage Pulsar.  Pulsar Manager is a large container and deployment requiring over 1GB of RAM, so is not deployed by default.  This is not a required component, it may be useful to help manage a large operational deployment.
pattern.name: pulsar-manager
pattern.title: Add Pulsar Manager

pattern.description: This pattern adds a core set of Trustgraph flows, including PDF ingest, chunking, embeddings, and knowledge graph extraction.  You should also consider adding an LLM and at least one RAG processing flow.
pattern.name: trustgraph-base
pattern.title: Add Trustgraph base processing flows

pattern.description: The core Trustgraph deployment does not include a GraphRag store; this pattern adds the Cassandra store, and adds GraphRAG adapters so that Cassandra is integrated with GraphRag indexing and querying.
pattern.name: graph-rag-cassandra
pattern.title: Add GraphRAG indexing and querying using Cassandra

pattern.description: The core Trustgraph deployment does not include a GraphRag store; this pattern adds the Neo4j store, and adds GraphRAG adapters so that Neo4j is integrated with GraphRag indexing and querying.
pattern.name: graph-rag-neo4j
pattern.title: Deploys GraphRAG indexing and querying using a Neo4j community edition store

args.name: prompt-knowledge-query-template

pattern.description: This pattern overrides the default knowledge query LLM prompt allowing you to provide your own prompt.
pattern.name: prompt-template-kq-query
pattern.title: Override knowledge query prompt

args.default:
<instructions>
Study the following text and derive definitions for any discovered entities.
Do not provide definitions for entities whose definitions are incomplete
or unknown.
Output relationships in JSON format as an arary of objects with fields:
- entity: the name of the entity
- definition: English text which defines the entity
</instructions>

<text>
{text}
</text>

<requirements>
You will respond only with raw JSON format data. Do not provide
explanations. Do not use special characters in the abstract text. The
abstract will be written as plain text.  Do not add markdown formatting
or headers or prefixes.  Do not include null or unknown definitions.
</requirements>
args.name: prompt-definition-template

pattern.description: This pattern overrides the default definition extraction LLM prompt allowing you to provide your own prompt.
pattern.name: prompt-template-definitions
pattern.title: Override definition extraction prompt

args.default:
<instructions>
Study the following text and derive entity relationships.  For each
relationship, derive the subject, predicate and object of the relationship.
Output relationships in JSON format as an arary of objects with fields:
- subject: the subject of the relationship
- predicate: the predicate
- object: the object of the relationship
- object-entity: false if the object is a simple data type: name, value or date.  true if it is an entity.
</instructions>

<text>
{text}
</text>

<requirements>
You will respond only with raw JSON format data. Do not provide
explanations. Do not use special characters in the abstract text. The
abstract must be written as plain text.  Do not add markdown formatting
or headers or prefixes.
</requirements>
args.name: prompt-relationship-template

pattern.description: This pattern overrides the default relationship extraction LLM prompt allowing you to provide your own prompt.
pattern.name: prompt-template-relationships
pattern.title: Override relationship extraction prompt

args.name: prompt-document-query-template

pattern.description: This pattern overrides the default document query prompt used for DocumentRAG allowing you to specify your own prompt.
pattern.name: prompt-template-document-query
pattern.title: Override document query prompt

args.default:
<instructions>
Study the following text and derive objects which match the schema provided.

You must output an array of JSON objects for each object you discover
which matches the schema.  For each object, output a JSON object whose fields
carry the name field specified in the schema.
</instructions>

<schema>
{schema}
</schema>

<text>
{text}
</text>

<requirements>
You will respond only with raw JSON format data. Do not provide
explanations. Do not add markdown formatting or headers or prefixes.
</requirements>
args.name: prompt-rows-template

pattern.description: This pattern overrides the default table/row extraction prompt to be changed.  This is used for DatabaseRAG pipelines.
pattern.name: prompt-template-rows-template
pattern.title: Override table/row extraction prompt

pattern.description: The default chunker used in Trustgraph core is a token-based chunker.  This pattern replaces that with a recursive chunker, and allows ou to configure the chunking parameters.
pattern.name: override-recursive-chunker
pattern.title: Replace default chunker with recursive chunker

pattern.description: This pattern integrates an Azure LLM endpoint hosted in the Azure cloud for text completion operations.  You need an Azure subscription and to have an endpoint deployed to be able to use this service.
pattern.name: azure
pattern.title: Add Azure LLM endpoint for text completion

pattern.description: This pattern integrates an AWS Bedrock LLM service hosted in the AWS cloud for text completion operations.  You need an AWS cloud subscription and to have Bedrock configured to be able to use this service.
pattern.name: bedrock
pattern.title: Add AWS Bedrock for text completion

pattern.description: This pattern integrates an Anthropic Claude LLM service for text completion operations.  You need a Claude subscription to be able to use this service.
pattern.name: claude
pattern.title: Add Anthropic Claude for text completion

pattern.description: This pattern integrates the Cohere LLM service for text completion operations.  You need a Cohere subscription and API keys to be able to use this service.
pattern.name: cohere
pattern.title: Add Cohere LLM endpoint for text completion

pattern.description: This pattern integrates an Ollama service for text completion operations.  You need to have a running Ollama service with the necessary models added in order to be able to use this service.
pattern.name: ollama
pattern.title: Add Ollama LLM for text completion

pattern.description: This pattern integrates an OpenAI LLM service for text completion operations.  You need an OpenAI subscription and have an API key to be able to use this service.
pattern.name: openai
pattern.title: Add OpenAI LLM endpoint for text completion

pattern.description: This pattern integrates a VertexAI endpoint hosted in Google Cloud for text completion operations.  You need a GCP subscription and to have VertexAI enabled to be able to use this service.
pattern.name: vertexai
pattern.title: Add Google Cloud VertexAI LLM for text completion

pattern.description: The Trustgraph core does not include a vector store by default.  This configuration pattern adds a simple Milvus store and integrates with embeddings handling.
pattern.name: vector-store-milvus
pattern.title: Add Milvus, a vector embeddings store

pattern.description: The Trustgraph core does not include a vector store by default.  This configuration pattern adds a simple Qdrant store and integrates with embeddings handling.
pattern.name: vector-store-qdrant
pattern.title: Adds Qdrant, a vector embeddings store

pattern.description: System monitoring and dashboarding using Grafana and Prometheus
pattern.name: grafana
pattern.title: Add Prometheus and Grafana for monitoring and dashboards
